intro: Chaetaria capillacea, commonly known as the silky chaetaria, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive, silky appearance. It is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
